election_record.label: New York 1798 Governor

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: The Northern Budget (Troy, NY) lists 1161 votes for Robert Livingston.

sub_unit.name: Cambridge
sub_unit.note: The Northern Budget (Troy, NY) lists 25 votes for Robert Livingston.

sub_unit.name: Ulster
sub_unit.note: The Poughkeepsie Journal list 452 votes for John Jay and 599 votes for Robert Livingston.

sub_unit.name: Southern
sub_unit.note: The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) and Hudson Gazette (Hudson, NY) list 2759 votes for Robert Livingston.

sub_unit.name: Four
sub_unit.note: The Goshen Repository, The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY), Hudson Gazette (Hudson, NY) and Northern Centinel all list 146 votes for John Jay.

sub_unit.name: Six
sub_unit.note: The Goshen Repository lists 181 votes.
The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY), Hudson Gazette (Hudson, NY) and Northern Centinel all list 188 votes for Robert Livingston.

sub_unit.name: Seven
sub_unit.note: The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY), Hudson Gazette (Hudson, NY) and Northern Centinel all list 130 votes for John Jay.

sub_unit.name: Queens
sub_unit.note: Hudson Gazette (Hudson, NY) lists 307 votes for Robert Livingston.

sub_unit.name: South Hempstead
sub_unit.note: Queens County in Olden Times. Henry Onderdonk, Jr., A.M., Jamaica, N.Y.: Charles Welling 1865, lists 214 votes for John Jay.

sub_unit.name: Suffolk
sub_unit.note: Goshen Repository, and The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 799 votes for Robert Livingston.
The Packet (Catskill, NY) lists 810 votes for Robert Livingston.

sub_unit.name: Cortlandt
sub_unit.note: Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY) lists the town name as "Coutland Town".

sub_unit.name: Green
sub_unit.note: "Town of Green lost - 17 votes, poll list not signed." Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 9, 1798.

sub_unit.name: Jerico
sub_unit.note: The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 1 vote for John Jay.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 701 votes for Robert Livingston.

sub_unit.name: Manilius
sub_unit.note: "Manlius (lost)." The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY). June 18, 1798.
"The Town of Manlius lost, about 60, U.S. House of Representatives and Governor together." Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 9, 1798

sub_unit.name: Ontario
sub_unit.note: "Town not named lost - 24 votes, poll list not signed. Bristol also lost - 41 votes, Governor, Senators, U.S. House of Representatives, all in one ballot." Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 9, 1798.

sub_unit.name: Bristol
sub_unit.note: "No Name and Bristol (lost)." The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY). June 18, 1798.

sub_unit.name: Genesee
sub_unit.note: Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY) lists the town name as "Tennessee".

sub_unit.name: Unknown Town 1
sub_unit.note: "No Name and Bristol (lost)." The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY). June 18, 1798.

sub_unit.name: Suffrage
sub_unit.note: The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) lists 4 votes for John Jay.

sub_unit.name: Briston
sub_unit.note: "Briston (Lost)." The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY). June 18, 1798.

sub_unit.name: Cobleskill
sub_unit.note: Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY) and The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY) list the town name as "Cobuskill".

sub_unit.name: Middleburgh
sub_unit.note: Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY) lists the town name as "Middlebury".

sub_unit.name: Steuben
sub_unit.note: "Middletown 21, and a town, not named, 25 votes, in Steuben County, were lost." Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 9, 1798

sub_unit.name: Middletown
sub_unit.note: "Middletown and No Name (Lost)." The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY). June 18, 1798.

sub_unit.name: Unknown Town 2
sub_unit.note: "Middletown and No Name (Lost)." The Albany Gazette (Albany, NY). June 18, 1798.

election_record.reference: Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). May 20, 1798.
Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 2, 1798.
Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 6, 1798.
Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 9, 1798.
Greenleaf's New York Journal, and Patriotic Register (New York, NY). June 13, 1798.
